abstract: Jason Zinoman On Comedy column examines television comedies that are defying genre's tropes in order to pursue more varied tone; argues that rise of DVD and streaming services have allowed creators to provide more narrative depth in comedy, cliffhangers and all.
lead_paragraph: Television comedies, particularly the non-network kind, are willing to sacrifice laughs in pursuit of more varied and unpredictable pleasures.

headline.main: Why New TV Comedies Are Choosing Plot Over Jokes
headline.print_headline: More Plot Than Jokes. Can These Be Sitcoms?

snippet: Television comedies, particularly the non-network kind, are willing to sacrifice laughs in pursuit of more varied and unpredictable pleasures.
